title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: Set in the American South during the 1930s, the story of young Scout Finch, whose father, a lawyer, defends a black man accused of raping a white woman. A powerful exploration of racial injustice and moral growth.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling portrait of a totalitarian future where critical thought is suppressed under a regime of surveillance and propaganda. The novel follows Winston Smith as he rebels against the omnipresent government led by Big Brother.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The spirited Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of manners, upbringing, morality, and marriage in the society of early 19th-century England. Her relationship with the wealthy and proud Mr. Darcy forms the core of this beloved novel.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby pursues Daisy Buchanan, a wealthy young woman whom he loved in his youth. Exploring themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, and social upheaval.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the beloved series follows young Harry Potter, who discovers on his eleventh birthday that he is the orphaned son of two powerful wizards and possesses unique magical powers of his own.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins, a comfort-loving hobbit, is swept into an epic quest by the wizard Gandalf and a company of dwarves. Their journey takes them through treacherous lands swarming with goblins, orcs, and dangerous trolls.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City, is living in an unspecified institution in California after the events of the novel. The book details two days in his life after being expelled from prep school and his subsequent journey to New York City.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel set in Middle-earth, a world created by Tolkien. The story begins as a sequel to his earlier fantasy novel The Hobbit and follows hobbit Frodo Baggins as he embarks on a quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family, whose patriarch, José Arcadio Buendía, founded the fictional town of Macondo. The novel is often cited as one of the supreme achievements in world literature.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: Set in a futuristic World State, inhabited by genetically modified citizens and an intelligence-based social hierarchy, the novel anticipates huge scientific advancements in reproductive technology, sleep-learning, psychological manipulation, and classical conditioning.

title: Things Fall Apart
author: Chinua Achebe
description: The story of Okonkwo, a respected warrior in the Umuofia clan of the Igbo tribe, and explores the effects of British colonialism on African society. Considered a milestone in African literature.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: The magical story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who yearns to travel in search of a worldly treasure. His quest will lead him to riches far different—and far more satisfying—than he ever imagined.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The story of Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in Saint Petersburg who formulates a plan to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker for her money. A profound psychological study of guilt and redemption.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, the nation of Panem forces each of its twelve districts to send a teenage boy and girl to compete in the Hunger Games, a nationally televised event in which the 'tributes' must fight to the death until one remains.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A groundbreaking narrative of humanity's creation and evolution that explores how biology and history have defined us and enhanced our understanding of what it means to be 'human.'

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: The unforgettable, heartbreaking story of the unlikely friendship between a wealthy boy and the son of his father's servant, caught in the tragic sweep of history, The Kite Runner transports readers to Afghanistan at a tense and crucial moment of change and destruction.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Set in a future American society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found, the novel follows Guy Montag, a fireman who becomes disillusioned with his role of censoring literature and destroying knowledge.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: Set after the American Civil War, the novel tells the story of a family of former slaves whose Cincinnati home is haunted by a malevolent spirit. A powerful examination of the psychological effects of slavery and racism.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: Set in a near-future New England, in a totalitarian state known as Gilead, the novel explores themes of women in subjugation to misogyny, and the various means by which they gain individualism and independence.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and his young son walk alone through burned America, heading through the ravaged landscape to the coast. The novel explores themes of death, violence and cultural collapse, while examining the depths of human struggles for survival.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University. A powerful tale of self-invention, loyalty, and the struggle for education.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death there is a library. When Nora Seed finds herself in the Midnight Library, she has a chance to make different choices and explore the possibilities of her life that might have been.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A nostalgic story of loss and burgeoning sexuality. The story's protagonist and narrator is Toru Watanabe, who looks back on his days as a college student living in Tokyo as he is transported back to his youth by a Beatles song.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: Alicia Berenson's life is seemingly perfect. One evening her husband Gabriel returns home late, and Alicia shoots him five times in the face, and then never speaks another word. This shocking mystery enthralls London and captivates forensic psychotherapist Theo Faber.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set in Nazi Germany, the novel follows Liesel Meminger, a young girl living with her foster parents. The story is narrated by Death, who tells the tale of Liesel, a girl who steals books and shares them with others during the horrors of the Third Reich.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, the story explores the complex, multi-layered planet-spanning civilization that has evolved over thousands of years. A stunning blend of adventure and mysticism, environmentalism and politics.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: The circus arrives without warning. It is called Le Cirque des Rêves, and it is only open at night. But behind the scenes, a fierce competition is underway—a duel between two young magicians who have been trained since childhood for this purpose.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: The story follows the lives of the four March sisters—Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy—and details their passage from childhood to womanhood. Loosely based on the lives of the author and her three sisters, it is a timeless tale of family life and growing up.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: The story of a fashionable young man who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty. As Dorian's portrait ages and records every sin and act of corruption, he remains young and beautiful. A masterpiece of the aestheticism movement.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Liu Cixin
description: Set against the backdrop of China's Cultural Revolution, a secret military project sends signals into space to establish contact with aliens. An alien civilization on the brink of destruction captures the signal and plans to invade Earth.
